intro: Ornithogalum bonariense, commonly known as the Brazilian star of Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum bonariense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be grown in gardens with proper care.
